meanings.sent1: The grayscale photo had no bright colors, just different shades of gray.
meanings.sent2: The artist used a grayscale palette to create a monochromatic painting.
meanings.sent3: I tried to add some color to the grayscale picture, but it turned out looking like a strange rainbow.
meanings.sent4: Her world felt like a grayscale movie, lacking the vibrancy of real life.
meanings.sent5: The grayscale landscape was hauntingly beautiful in its simplicity.

meanings.definition: A range of gray shades from white to black.
meanings.sent1: The printer produced a perfect grayscale of the image, capturing all the details.
meanings.sent2: The artist carefully blended different shades of gray to create a realistic grayscale.
meanings.sent3: When the color printer malfunctioned, all the photos came out in grayscale, making everyone look like ghosts.
meanings.sent4: The city skyline at dusk was a striking grayscale against the orange sky.
meanings.sent5: The grayscale of the old photograph added a nostalgic feel to the memory.
